data.title: Taylor Swift releases live version and remix of 'Cruel Summer'
data.meta_description: Taylor Swift has released a live version of her 2019 song 'Cruel Summer', taken from her Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour film. Taylor released the live track along with a remix.
data.text:
Taylor Swift has treated fans to two new versions of her huge track 'Cruel Summer', including a live version from her 'The Eras Tour' concert film.

The film is now available to watch in cinemas worldwide and has been hugely popular, having generated a huge $100 million in the box office in the USA and Canada alone. Now, fans can enjoy listening to a live version of 'Cruel Summer' from 'The Eras Tour', in addition to a newly released LP Giobbi remix of the track.

Taking to social media, Taylor thanked fans for their incredible reaction to the film. She wrote: 'What a truly mind blowing thing you've turned The Eras Tour Concert Film into. I've been watching videos of you guys in the theaters dancing and prancing and recreating choreography, creating inside jokes, casting spells, getting engaged and just generally creating the exact type of joyful chaos we're known for.

'One of my favorite things you've done was when you supported Cruel Summer SO much, I ended up starting The Eras Tour show with it. For old times sake, I'm releasing the live audio from the tour so we can all shriek it in the comfort of our homes and cars PLUS a brand new remix by @lpgiobbi. Thank you, so much, forever, wow, just thank you!!!' (sic)

'Cruel Summer' features on Taylor's 2019 album 'Lover' and is one of the 44 songs on 'The Eras Tour' set list, which encompasses songs from all 10 of her studio albums. 'The Eras Tour' concert film features performances from Taylor's six concerts at the SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles earlier in the year.

Swifties can also look forward to the UK 'The Eras Tour' concerts, with Taylor set to perform in Edinburgh, Liverpool, Cardiff and London in 2024.
